ai.summary: A short, easy 0.4 km footpath hike in the UK, ideal for beginners, families, and a quick outdoor break. The route is on a gentle, well-maintained path with minimal elevation and relaxed pacing.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily a flat or gently graded footpath, typically surfaced or well-trodden. Expect typical countryside terrain with occasional damp or muddy patches after rain; suitable for all fitness levels.
ai.safety_notes: Always check the weather and daylight hours before you go. Wear comfortable walking shoes and bring a light waterproof layer. Stay on the designated path, be mindful of other walkers, and keep a safe distance from any livestock. Carry water and a mobile phone for emergencies; in winter, watch for icy sections.
recommended_gear: Phone with offline map or local directions
ai.best_seasons: All year, though late spring to early autumn typically offer the most pleasant conditions in the UK. Be mindful of mud or icy patches in winter.

seo.title: Footpath 133: Easy 0.4 km UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover Footpath 133, a short and easy 0.4 km hike in the UK. Read about terrain, safety tips, gear, and the best seasons for this quick outdoor stroll.
